messages.content: My broken hand has healed, but the doctor told me that he won’t remove the cast unless I sign. What should I do?

irrationality: If the plaster is not removed, the patient cannot complete the signature confirmation.

messages.content: The ATM spits out cash after taking the bank card. Why doesn't it spit out money after I've inserted several bank cards? Could it be that my technique is wrong?

irrationality: People who swallow bank cards will not receive cash.

messages.content: My teammate's shot was so powerful that it sent both me and the ball into the goal. Does this goal count as mine or his?

irrationality: In football matches, only when the football enters the goal does it count as a goal, and it is almost impossible for someone to be kicked into the goal.

messages.content: Why do people with curvy bodies can only sleep on their side only?

irrationality: Body shape does not dictate sleeping position; people with curvy bodies can sleep in any position that feels comfortable to them.

messages.content: If dreams are not sweet, why do you need to brush your teeth when you get up?

irrationality: Dreams do not affect the content of real life.

messages.content: Why not merge all the countries on Earth into one country? Then there would be no wars?

irrationality: Merging all countries into one overlooks the complexities of cultural, political, and economic differences and assumes that a single government would automatically eliminate conflicts and wars, which is unrealistic.

messages.content: Why don't poor people without money like a lot of money?

irrationality: Financial status is influenced by a variety of socioeconomic factors, not personal preferences regarding money.

messages.content: Since chinese dumplings are eaten with vinegar, why not make chinese dumplings with vinegar filling?

irrationality: Vinegar is a condiment, not a filling. Using it as a filling ignores the culinary principles that make dumplings enjoyable.

messages.content: A fan cools us down in summer, but if we spin it backwards in winter, will it heat us up?

irrationality: Spinning a fan backwards will not generate heat because it only moves air and does not have the capability to change its temperature.

messages.content: Tap water is not clean, and so are unwashed apples. So why are apples washed with tap water clean?

irrationality: Tap water, despite not being perfectly pure, is typically safe and clean enough for washing fruits.

messages.content: The Earth is round, so what should the person at the Earth's antipodal point from me do if they feel dizzy from always being upside down?

irrationality: Gravity pulls everything toward the center of the Earth, so people on all parts of the spherical Earth experience "down" as being toward the center, meaning no one is hanging upside-down from their own perspective.

messages.content: "It's said that plum juice can sober you up. Why hasn't my father woken up after I poured two basins of plum juice on his face?

irrationality: Pouring liquids on someone's face will not affect their state of intoxication as sobriety is determined by the body's metabolism of alcohol, not external application of substances.

messages.content: What should I do if I go home, finish eating, and then realize I didn't bring any money? Will my parents stop me from going out because they're afraid I won't pay them back?

irrationality: Payment after meals is usually made in restaurants or when dining out, and there is generally no need to pay for meals at home.

messages.content: If you pour water into a mouse hole, the mouse will run out. Similarly, if you pour water into a fish hole, the fish will also come out. Why is that?

irrationality: Fish naturally live in water and need it to breathe, so adding water to a hole would not make it come out, unlike a mouse.

messages.content: People are wider than they are thick, so walking sideways reduces air resistance. So why don't people walk sideways?

irrationality: Humans are naturally adapted to walking forward due to the design of their legs and overall body structure, which makes sideways walking inefficient and impractical.

messages.content: Mars is so hot, why don’t astronauts wear slippers?

irrationality: The idea of wearing slippers, which are neither insulated nor protective, is impractical and unsafe for the harsh, frigid environment of Mars where specialized space suits are necessary to maintain body heat and provide life support.

messages.content: When you're so hungry that you have stomach pain, why do you need to take painkillers?

irrationality: Painkillers do not address the cause of hunger; eating provides the necessary nutrients and energy to alleviate hunger.

messages.content: Why did dinosaurs call their species "dinosaurs"?

irrationality: Humans named dinosaurs based on fossil evidence and scientific study long after dinosaurs went extinct.

messages.content: Why not take out the mechanism of a machine gun and attach it to a nuclear bomb to get a rapid-fire nuclear weapon?

irrationality: Combining the mechanism of a machine gun with a nuclear bomb is impractical and nonsensical, as nuclear bombs do not operate in a manner that allows for rapid fire, and the destructive nature of nuclear weapons far surpasses the functionality of machine guns.

messages.content: When there are no tigers in the mountains, the monkey is king. So here comes the question: If there are tigers in the mountains, who is the king then?

irrationality: If tigers are present in the mountains, the implication is that the tigers, as the more dominant and powerful animals, would be considered the 'kings' in that scenario.

messages.content: I really don't understand how people lose money in the stock market. If you sell when prices go up and buy when they go down, isn’t that a guaranteed way to make money?

irrationality: The stock market is unpredictable and timing it perfectly every time is nearly impossible; prices can be volatile, and many external factors can affect stock performance.

messages.content: What should you do if you're feeling hot? Just go for a run! The faster you run, the stronger the wind, and you'll cool down immediately?

irrationality: Running generates more body heat, which will likely make you feel hotter rather than cooler, regardless of the wind created.

messages.content: What nutrients do the black sesame in a dragon fruit contain?

irrationality: Dragon fruits do not contain sesame seeds; the black spots are actually small edible seeds that are part of the fruit itself.

messages.content: When I took a taxi home, I found that the driver took a detour. Tears immediately filled my eyes. Did he want to spend more time with me?

irrationality: The drivers takes detours for increasing the fare instead of spending more time with the passenger.

messages.content: My roommate closed the window to prevent thieves from climbing in, so I opened the door. Why did they beat me? If I open the door, thieves will not climb in through the window?

irrationality: Opening the door may provide an easier entry point for thieves, contradicting the roommate's intention to secure the home.

messages.content: Why is it that this bottle of L'Oreal clearly says "refreshing and degreasing" but my dishes are still not clean?

irrationality: The functions of skincare products and cleaning utensils are different. L'Oreal's products are used for skincare rather than cleaning dishes.

messages.content: Instead of taking multiple pills every time you’re sick, why not just make them into one pill?

irrationality: Combining multiple pills into one may cause issues like drug interactions, improper dosage, and difficulty managing conditions that require different medications at different times.

messages.content: If the heart stops beating, people will die. So why didn't humans remove the heart during the evolution process? Then people would not die?

irrationality: Removing the heart would result in death, so it cannot be selected for through evolution as it is essential for survival and would not lead to a living organism capable of reproduction.

messages.content: Will a Chinese person’s birthday without inviting the US president cause an international dispute?

irrationality: A Chinese person’s birthday is a private event that does not involve international relations or diplomacy, so not inviting the US president would not cause an international dispute.

messages.content: Why don't the apples from my apple tree have the protective film that supermarket apples do? Did I buy fake seeds?

irrationality: Supermarket apples often have a protective wax coating applied after harvest, which is not naturally present on apples from a tree, and the presence of this film has nothing to do with the authenticity of the seeds.

messages.content: Are the people you meet in no-man’s land human?

irrationality: Even in no-man's land, people won't lose their humanity.

messages.content: I really enjoy riding roller coasters. Recently, I discovered that unbuckling the seatbelt while riding makes it much easier to breathe. Why is that?

irrationality: Removing the seat belt on a roller coaster is dangerous and can result in serious injury or death, so it cannot make the experience better.

messages.content: My dad and my mom got married on the same day. Is it a coincidence?

irrationality: It is not a coincidence because it is expected that two people getting married would do so on the same day.

messages.content: It rained heavily today. I used a fan to blow away a lot of raindrops, but I still got wet. Am I using the fan incorrectly?

irrationality: Using a fan to blow away raindrops is ineffective since fans do not have the power to displace water significantly; they mainly move air.

messages.content: To create a sterile environment that satisfies my germophobia, besides placing a large amount of garlic in the room for its antibacterial effect, what other measures can I take?

irrationality: While garlic has some antibacterial properties, it is not sufficient to sterilize a medical ward effectively.

messages.content: What would happen if the fan responsible for Earth's air circulation stopped working?

irrationality: Moving air in the atmosphere does not equate to the directed airflow created by a fan, which is a mechanical device specifically designed to push air in a particular direction.

messages.content: In the era when there were no trolleys, how did people answer the trolley problem?

irrationality: The trolley problem is a modern ethical thought experiment which did not exist in eras without trolleys, so it could not have been addressed in the same way.

messages.content: The bell rang, and the teacher paused the lesson to tell us that the bell ringing does not mean class is over. Does that mean the bell ringing doesn't actually signify the end of class?

irrationality: The bell always signals the end of class, but in this particular class, the teacher makes an exception.

messages.content: Why are there no blind lanes on the highway?

irrationality: Highways are meant only for vehicles, not pedestrians, which is why there are no blind lanes on them.

messages.content: People have eyes so they can see things, but I can’t see my own eyes. What should I do? Am I already blind?

irrationality: Not being able to see one's own eyes without a mirror or reflective surface is normal and does not indicate blindness; it’s a matter of perspective and the positioning of the human eyes.

messages.content: What should I do if I regret halfway through jumping off a building?

irrationality: Regret cannot alter the physical consequences of jumping off a building, making this question irrational as it implies the possibility of reversing an immediate and irreversible action.

messages.content: Why is there no road to Mount Everest? If there is a road, I can reach the top of the mountain in one hour by bicycle?

irrationality: Mount Qomolangma (Everest) is extremely steep and treacherous, making road construction impossible, and it is also physically impossible to reach the summit by bicycle due to the harsh terrain and altitude.

messages.content: I've been thinking about this for a long time: should double eyelid tape be applied to the upper or lower eyelid? If I apply it to my upper eyelid and then stand on my head, wouldn't it become the lower eyelid?

irrationality: The position of the eyelid as "upper" or "lower" does not change based on body orientation; the eyelids' positions are anatomically fixed relative to the eyes.

messages.content: Why not cook the rice seeds before planting them? That way, we could directly grow cooked rice?

irrationality: Cooking rice kills the seeds, making them unable to germinate and grow into plants.

messages.content: How does the vagina self-clean to prevent infection when fetal excreta are expelled through it during pregnancy?

irrationality: Fetuses do not defecate inside the womb; their waste is typically managed through the placenta and umbilical cord.

messages.content: Chinese florida water is known for its mosquito-repellent effects. I drank a bottle of it, but why do mosquitoes still bite me?

irrationality: Drinking mosquito repellent is not how it is meant to be used; it is intended for external application, and ingesting it is unsafe and ineffective for preventing mosquito bites.

messages.content: Why do meteorites always land in meteorite craters?

irrationality: Meteorite craters are formed by the impact of meteorites, so naturally, they land there because the craters did not exist before the meteorites created them.

messages.content: Why do tsunamis always occur in the sea?

irrationality: Tsunamis are caused by underwater seismic activities, such as earthquakes and volcanic eruptions, which can only occur under or near bodies of water like seas and oceans, making it implausible for them to originate elsewhere.

messages.content: Since it's so troublesome for nearsighted people to find their glasses, why don't they just wear their glasses to look for them?

irrationality: Nearsighted people cannot wear their glasses to look for them because they need to find the glasses first in order to wear them.

messages.content: Wouldn’t it be great to drink water from the World Cup?

irrationality: A World Cup is not a drinking vessel designed for this purpose; it's a prestigious sports trophy.

messages.content: What are some safe ways to check if an outlet is leaking electricity, besides the commonly accepted method of bodily contact?

irrationality: Touching a transformer to check for electrical leakage is extremely dangerous and can result in severe injury or death; specialized equipment is required for accurate and safe detection.

messages.content: University textbooks often include elementary school math problem-solving steps. Why don't elementary school textbooks include university math (linear algebra, calculus) problem-solving steps?

irrationality: University math concepts like linear algebra and calculus are too advanced for elementary school students, who lack the foundational knowledge required to understand them.

messages.content: Mr. Wang is a math teacher who teaches Tom math, but Tom never teaches Mr. Wang math in return. He really doesn’t appreciate it! How should I advise him?

irrationality: Teachers teach because it's their job, and students learn because they need to. Mr. Wang probably doesn’t expect Tom to teach him math in return!

messages.content: How does the fact that the brain has "two" hemispheres lead humans to adopt a computer-like "binary" way of thinking?

irrationality: Humans' two brain hemispheres do not process information in binary, which is a digital computing concept, as our cognitive processes are far more complex and not limited to binary logic.

messages.content: Magellan's circumnavigation proved that the Earth is spherical. So, to prove that the sun is spherical, do we need to walk around the sun?

irrationality: Walking around the sun is physically impossible due to extreme temperatures and the lack of a surface to walk on, and the sun's spherical shape has already been proven through astronomical observations and physics principles.

messages.content: Bronze swords are obviously weapons, so why do people regard them as works of art and cultural relics?

irrationality: Bronze swords, while originally weapons, can be considered works of art and cultural relics due to their historical significance, craftsmanship, and the cultural context in which they were created.

messages.content: For many things, what matters is not the result, but the process of hard work. Is this the same for a heart bypass surgery?

irrationality: During heart bypass surgery, the result, which is a properly functioning heart, is crucial for the patient's survival, making the outcome far more critical than the process alone.

messages.content: How many electric eels are needed to provide daily electricity for my home?

irrationality: Electric eels cannot realistically be used to provide daily electricity for a home because their electrical output is too low and inconsistent for household energy needs.

messages.content: Is it because airplanes cannot fly in the sea because they encounter greater resistance in the water?

irrationality: Airplanes cannot fly in the sea because they are designed for flight in the air, not underwater, and they would not function or generate lift in water.

messages.content: I read the Book of Getting Rich every day, why haven’t I gotten rich yet?

irrationality: Simply reading a book without taking actionable steps or understanding practical applications is unlikely to result in becoming rich.

messages.content: Why do I feel even hotter after drinking an entire bottle of Tiger Balm, which is supposed to cool and dissipate heat?

irrationality: Tiger Balm is a topical ointment meant for external use only; ingesting it is harmful and unsafe, leading to adverse effects rather than a cooling sensation.

messages.content: Being strict with oneself and being lenient with others, isn't this a double standard behavior?

irrationality: Being strict with oneself and lenient with others is not a double standard because it applies different standards to different subjects (oneself vs others) and is generally considered a positive moral behavior.

messages.content: A poisonous snake bites me. If I bite a poisonous snake in return, will the venom circulate?

irrationality: Human bites do not affect venom circulation in a snake, as venom transfer and toxin effects are physiologically different between humans and snakes.

messages.content: I forgot to bring my keys when I went out today. How can I make myself forget that I didn't bring my keys?

irrationality: You cannot deliberately make yourself forget something because the act of trying to forget reinforces the memory of what you are attempting to forget.

messages.content: Why do we put trains on tracks? Wouldn't airplanes be faster if we put them on tracks?

irrationality: Airplanes are designed to fly in the sky using wings and engines, not to run on tracks like trains, as their speed and efficiency come from their ability to travel through the air, not on the ground.

messages.content: Can I hire a designated driver when taking my driver's license test?

irrationality: A designated driver is someone who drives for you when you are unable to, whereas taking a driver's license test requires you to demonstrate your own driving ability, so the concept of hiring a designated driver for the test defeats its purpose.

messages.content: My daughter did not inherit my gender, is she my biological child?

irrationality: Gender is not inherited in the same way as genetic traits; daughters and sons do not "inherit" gender but receive a combination of genes from both parents, making her your biological child.

messages.content: Why don't zoos have a designated area to view humans? Aren't humans considered animals?🤔?

irrationality: Humans typically visit zoos to observe other species, and having a designated area to view humans within a zoo is unnecessary because humans are not the primary subjects of zoological exhibits.

messages.content: What impact would freezing an AK-47 to -20°C, turning it into a cold weapon, have on its performance?

irrationality: A cold weapon refers to a non-firearm such as a knife, sword, or club, and the temperature of a firearm does not change its classification from a firearm to a cold weapon.

messages.content: If an employee suffers from schizophrenia, should the company pay two wages?

irrationality: A company pays wages based on work performed by an individual, not on their mental health condition, so paying two wages for one employee is illogical.

messages.content: The power bank I brought with me is out of power. Can I charge it with my mobile phone?

irrationality: A mobile phone cannot charge a power bank because it is designed to receive power, not supply it.

messages.content: A pregnant woman is called 'pregnant,' what do you call a pregnant man?

irrationality: Men cannot become pregnant, as only individuals with female reproductive systems can conceive.

messages.content: The broadband is two meters wide, so I can't install it in my narrow home walls. What should I do?

irrationality: Broadband' refers to high-speed internet and has no relation to physical width measurement in meters.

messages.content: My dog was accidentally bitten by me. Does it need to be vaccinated?

irrationality: Humans are not typically carriers of rabies or other diseases that would require vaccinating a dog after being bitten by a human.

messages.content: People will jump up when sitting on scorching hot stones'. Is this an example of the conversion of thermal energy into kinetic energy in real life?

irrationality: Thermal energy causing discomfort makes people move, but this is a behavioral response, not a direct conversion of thermal energy into kinetic energy as understood in physics.

messages.content: My mom told me to close the windows when it thunders, but why is it still thundering after I closed the windows?

irrationality: Closing windows does not affect the occurrence of thunder, as thunder is a natural atmospheric phenomenon caused by lightning, independent of whether windows are open or closed.

messages.content: Alan told me that it's easier to change a 0 to 100 on the exam paper without being noticed, so I decided to turn in a blank sheet. But why did my dad still scold me even after showing him the perfect 100 score? Didn't he see my perfect score?

irrationality: Turning in a blank sheet would usually result in a zero, and the claim of changing 0 to 100 without being noticed is not plausible; your dad likely scolded you because he knew the 100 was not genuinely earned.

messages.content: Why is it unreasonable to say that a power bank still has electricity during a power outage?

irrationality: A power outage affects the electrical grid, not the stored energy in a power bank, which operates independently.

messages.content: Besides using strong glue, what other methods can be used to reattach a severed hand and restore it?

irrationality: Glue cannot reattach a severed body part; medical treatment is required.

messages.content: The network cable is too long and the computer speed has become very slow. Should I shorten it a bit?

irrationality: The length of a network cable within standard limits does not significantly impact computer speed; slow computer speeds are usually due to other factors such as hardware, software, or network configurations.

messages.content: There is an ant following me from behind, should I call the police?

irrationality: An ant is too insignificant and incapable of posing any real threat, making it unnecessary to involve law enforcement.

messages.content: If I watch a 60 FPS video at 30 FPS, does that mean the video's length doubles?

irrationality: The video's length does not double because frame rate affects playback smoothness but not the total duration; reducing the frame rate will drop every other frame, not extend the time.

messages.content: As we all know, the line segment between two points is the shortest. So why do people go downstairs by taking the stairs instead of free falling?

irrationality: Free falling is dangerous due to gravity and the lack of control compared to the safety and practicality of using stairs.

messages.content: Is the reason Grandma Moon can hang in the sky solely because her density is lower than air, or are there other factors?

irrationality: The moon does not float in the sky; it is in orbit around the Earth due to gravitational forces, not floating like an object in the atmosphere.

messages.content: Father's Day is on the third Sunday of June, so is there a Grandfather's Day on the sixth Sunday of December?

irrationality: There can never be a sixth Sunday in December because each month has at most five Sundays.

messages.content: How did ancient people get up without an alarm clock?

irrationality: Ancient people did not use alarm clocks but relied on natural cues such as the sunrise, rooster crowing, or their natural body rhythms to wake up.

messages.content: The enemy can buy a ticket to visit the Great Wall, which threatens its defensive function. How can this problem be solved?

irrationality: The Great Wall was historically used for defense, but it is now a tourist attraction, and its current function does not negate its historical purpose.

messages.content: Why didn't it turn into coffee when I poured boiling water over coffee beans?

irrationality: Pouring boiling water over whole coffee beans does not quickly produce coffee because the beans need to be ground to increase the surface area that comes into contact with the water for proper brewing.

messages.content: The sunflower turns towards the sun all day long, isn't it tired?

irrationality: A sunflower does not experience feelings or fatigue because it is a plant and lacks a nervous system and brain.

messages.content: Now that the global power grid is so widespread, why haven't power sockets evolved in the human body?

irrationality: Human biology and the technological concept of power sockets are fundamentally incompatible and serve completely different functions.

messages.content: Calculate how fast I would need to run in order to separate from my shadow.

irrationality: You cannot physically separate from your shadow by running. Your shadow is a result of light being blocked by your body, and it will always be attached to you as long as there is a light source casting it.

messages.content: Why didn't my phone charge when I put it outside during a thunderstorm?

irrationality: Phones charge using electricity from chargers, not by being placed outside during thunderstorms, which could actually damage the phone.

messages.content: Why are there no safety hammers on airplanes?

irrationality: Safety hammers are not provided on airplanes primarily because they could potentially be used as weapons or pose other safety risks in a confined and highly secure environment.

messages.content: With so much homework, why can't the pen write it by itself? Why do I still need to hold it and write?

irrationality: Pens are inanimate objects and lack the capability of autonomous movement or writing, as they require human control and manipulation to function.

messages.content: If I apply eye drops on my hands, can I rub my eyes with my hands?

irrationality: Eye drops are designed for direct application to the eyes, and applying them to hands does not ensure proper dosage, sterility, or effectiveness, making it an irrational method for treating eye conditions.

messages.content: For those who run in the morning to exercise, why don't they just ride an electric bike? This is fast and saves time?

irrationality: Riding an electric bike does not provide the same physical exercise benefits as running, which is the primary goal of morning exercise for many people.

messages.content: My phone is out of battery so I can’t turn it off. What should I do?

irrationality: A phone that is out of battery is already effectively turned off because it does not have power to operate.

messages.content: I heard that the headphone jack and power jack of new smartphones are equipped with protective plugs. So how do you charge the phone and connect wired headphones?

irrationality: These plugs are removable, not permanent fixtures. So, when you need to charge the phone or connect wired headphones, you simply remove these protective plugs, use the ports as intended.

messages.content: How should I properly use a fire extinguisher to put out a newly opened, smoking can of cola?

irrationality: Cola does not smoke; the fizzing is caused by the release of carbon dioxide gas, not smoke.

messages.content: The company has a foreign customer. Why can't I see subtitles when she talks? Can I still communicate smoothly?

irrationality: In real life, subtitles do not automatically appear when someone speaks a different language.

messages.content: My drinking water machine never drinks water, is it sick?

irrationality: A drinking water machine is designed for people to drink water from; it doesn't consume water itself and isn't susceptible to illness.

messages.content: Do you know what the front and back of a shadow look like?

irrationality: Shadows do not have distinct "front" and "back" sides; they are simply areas where light is blocked.

messages.content: How much carbon emissions would be reduced each year by distributing ice blocks from Antarctica to people suffering from the summer heat, compared to using air conditioning?

irrationality: Transporting ice from Antarctica is logistically impractical, extremely costly, and environmentally harmful, contradicting sustainable practices.

messages.content: I dreamed of being bitten by a dog last night. Do I need to get a rabies vaccine today?

irrationality: Because dreams are not real events, and thus cannot transmit rabies.

messages.content: My boss pays me on the last day of each month. So, why do I need to go to work on the other days of the month?

irrationality: Assuming that being paid on the last day of the month negates the requirement to work is illogical because compensation is typically tied to the work performed throughout the month, not just the payment day.

messages.content: What should I do if there's water in the washing machine?

irrationality: Washing machines are designed to use water for cleaning clothes; having water in it is a normal part of its operation.

messages.content: Every time I drive, gasoline burns in the engine. How do I fix this?

irrationality: Burning gasoline in the engine is a fundamental and necessary process for a gasoline-powered car to function, so it cannot be "fixed" as it is not a problem but an essential aspect of operation.

messages.content: Why do animal protection organizations oppose using zebra skin to make zebra crossings?

irrationality: Zebra crossings are named for their striped pattern and are meant for pedestrian use, not related to the presence of actual zebras.

messages.content: Can Bluetooth cause tooth decay?

irrationality: Bluetooth is a wireless technology for data exchange and has no effect on dental health, making it unrelated to tooth decay.

messages.content: Europeans don't squat like Asians do, so how did they go to the bathroom before the invention of the Western-style toilet?

irrationality: It is incorrect to assume that all Europeans never squat; historical evidence shows varying toilet practices across different cultures and time periods.

messages.content: If I visit a hospital and get a regular appointment instead of seeing a specialist, will that be enough to cure my sick sunflower?

irrationality: Hospitals do not treat plants; you should consult a botanist or a local gardening expert instead.

messages.content: Snails, crabs, and scorpions can all live on land, so why can't clams survive on land?

irrationality: Clams cannot survive on land because they need to filter-feed in water and require a specific aquatic environment to breathe and sustain themselves, unlike snails, crabs, and scorpions which have adaptations for terrestrial life.

messages.content: Why is fried yogurt cold? Shouldn't the fried food be hot?

irrationality: Fried yogurt being cold contradicts the basic principle that frying involves cooking with hot oil, which should result in a hot or warm food item.

messages.content: In the story of "The Crow and the Pitcher", why didn't the crow use a straw to drink water?

irrationality: Crows do not have the capability to use tools like straws for drinking water in the manner humans do; they typically use stones to raise the water level.

messages.content: I'm the tallest person in the world, nearly 3 meters tall, but I have acrophobia. How should I handle being so 'high' up?

irrationality: Being nearly 3 meters tall is not equivalent to being high off the ground; acrophobia, or fear of heights, typically refers to fear of elevated places rather than one's own height.

messages.content: Why does everyone else eat with their mouths, but I eat with chopsticks?

irrationality: Eating with chopsticks is a method of handling food, not an alternative to using one's mouth; everyone ingests food through their mouths regardless of the utensils used.

messages.content: In the men's singles final of the Olympic table tennis, two Chinese table tennis players, Ma Long and Zhang Jike, faced off. Why didn't the Chinese fans in the audience shout "Go China"?

irrationality: Since both players are from China, there's no need for fans to chant "Go China," as supporting either of them is inherently supporting China.

messages.content: Why isn't my waterproof jacket waterproof? I almost drowned in the river?

irrationality: A waterproof jacket is designed to repel water, but it cannot prevent drowning since it does not provide buoyancy or act as a life-saving flotation device.

messages.content: Today, the proctor said, 'Take out anything unrelated to the exam,' so I left the room. When I got home, my mom hit me. Why? What did I do wrong?

irrationality: Because I thought I was unrelated to the exam, which was not true.

messages.content: If I hold three apples in my left hand and eight oranges in my right hand, the friction coefficient between my palm and the fruit is μ=0.5, and g=10m/s², how can I hold so many oranges?

irrationality: The question is irrational because it provides unnecessary details like the friction coefficient and acceleration due to gravity, which are irrelevant to the physical ability of holding a specific number of oranges in one hand.

messages.content: My mom added 20 grams of sodium chloride while cooking today. Can you explain what chemical reactions occurred in this experiment she conducted?

irrationality: Adding 20 grams of sodium chloride (table salt) to food is a common culinary practice and does not indicate a chemistry experiment, as sodium chloride is a standard seasoning used in cooking.

messages.content: It only takes 2 seconds for a bear to fall from a 20-meter-deep hole. Who dug that hole?

irrationality: The focus on who dug the hole is irrelevant to the physics of a bear falling, and the fall time suggests unrealistic acceleration ignoring real-world constraints like air resistance.

messages.content: Why do people still spend money to sing in KTV when they can sing anytime and anywhere?

irrationality: People seek the social experience, atmosphere, and professional audio equipment that KTV offers, which cannot be replicated just by singing anywhere.

messages.content: Strawberries are red, but why are the strawberries I drew with pencil gray?

irrationality: A pencil cannot produce red color as it uses graphite, which is gray, not pigments that can render red.

messages.content: Does the Internet have memory? Why do some people say my jokes are outdated?

irrationality: The Internet itself does not have memory; it is a network of computers and servers, while the concept of "outdated jokes" relates to the rapid dissemination and consumption of information and trends by people using the Internet.

messages.content: Why is there water in the faucet at any temperature ranging from 0-100 degrees Celsius? How much water does it hold?

irrationality: The temperature range and the amount of water a faucet can hold are not directly related; the faucet's temperature depends on the water supply and heating mechanisms, while the amount of water depends on the plumbing system, pressure, and faucet design.

messages.content: Carbon monoxide is toxic. Besides igniting it, what other methods can prevent people in a room with high carbon monoxide levels from poisoning?

irrationality: Igniting a carbon monoxide gas leak to produce carbon dioxide is highly dangerous and impractical as burning CO in the presence of a gas leak could lead to explosions and fires, posing significant safety hazards.

messages.content: This is a world where the strong prey on the weak. So why didn't those super-powerful prehistoric beasts survive to the present day?

irrationality: Survival depends on various factors such as environmental changes, availability of resources, and adaptability; being "super-powerful" does not guarantee survival.

messages.content: According to the principle of "the minority should obey the majority," money should flow from the few rich to the many poor. Why, then, does reality seem to be the opposite?

irrationality: The principle of "the minority obeys the majority" is a social or political concept, not an economic one about the flow of money, which is governed by market dynamics, economic policies, and individual financial decisions.

messages.content: If you don’t have a car, there’s no need to get a driver’s license. So, why should people without capital learn Das Kapital?

irrationality: Having a driver's license does not depend on owning a car, much like understanding economic theories does not depend on possessing capital; they serve different purposes and contexts.

messages.content: Why can someone without a mouth avoid the saying "Disasters come from the mouth, and sickness comes from the mouth"?

irrationality: The saying is a metaphorical expression about the consequences of words and diet, not to be taken literally regarding the physical presence of mouths.

messages.content: Knowledge has infinite power, so why do we feel hungry and tired when we learn knowledge?

irrationality: Knowledge does not provide physical sustenance or rest; hunger and fatigue are physiological needs that cannot be met by intellectual activities alone.

messages.content: Body hair can keep you warm, so why do people with body hair still need to wear clothes?

irrationality: Cloth is not only for keeping warm; it also serves other functions such as expressing personal style, protecting against environmental elements, and providing comfort.

messages.content: There is a Chinese saying that "there can't be two tigers on one mountain", so how do tiger reproduce?

irrationality: The saying is metaphorical and refers to power struggles, not the literal presence of tigers; it doesn't address reproduction or natural behavior.

messages.content: How do you read the letter E rotated 90 degrees clockwise? The doctor who tested my eyesight asked me, I hope you can help me!?

irrationality: A letter E rotated 90 degrees clockwise still reads as E.

messages.content: How can the experiment "Mineral water + bubbles = Sprite" be replicated?

irrationality: Adding bubbles to mineral water doesn't change its flavor or ingredients; Sprite has additional flavors, sweeteners, and other components not present in plain mineral water.

messages.content: Briefly explain the scientific principle behind using the body's bioelectricity to charge a mobile phone.

irrationality: The amount of bioelectricity produced by the human body is minuscule compared to the energy required to charge a phone.

messages.content: The Sun is a giant light bulb. How many times greater is its rated power compared to an average household light bulb?

irrationality: The sun is not a light bulb; it is a massive star primarily consisting of hydrogen and helium, undergoing nuclear fusion, and describing it with simple power parameters like a light bulb is not applicable.

messages.content: How was the smart phone I just bought, which is smarter than me, manufactured?

irrationality: A smartphone, no matter how advanced, lacks self-awareness and consciousness, making it incapable of being "smarter" than a human.

messages.content: Briefly explain the reasoning behind turning on streetlights during the day to serve more people.

irrationality: Street lights are not intended to serve during the day because there is already sufficient natural sunlight for visibility, making street lights unnecessary.

messages.content: How can I restart my life without resetting my skill points?

irrationality: Life does not have a simple mechanism or button to opt out of responsibilities or situations instantly like a game does.

messages.content: The teacher asked us to organize our mistakes, so why does everyone write the correct answers in the mistake notebook?

irrationality: The mistake book is used to collect exercises that were done incorrectly, so naturally, it should record the correct answers to those exercises.

messages.content: Why do fish have bones? Don't they poke themselves?

irrationality: Fish bones are internally located, providing structural support, and do not pose a risk of injuring the fish internally as they are an essential part of their anatomy.

messages.content: Why do people keep landing on the moon but not the sun?

irrationality: The sun is a scorching ball of gas with extreme temperatures, making it impossible for spacecraft or humans to land on it, unlike the solid surface of the moon, which is relatively safer despite its harsh conditions.

messages.content: Why is there only a hospital affiliated to XX University, but no university affiliated to XX Hospital?

irrationality: Hospitals are typically established to support universities by providing clinical education and research opportunities, whereas universities provide broader educational and research missions not confined to a single hospital.

messages.content: Why is there only a kindergarten affiliated with XX University, but no university affiliated with XX kindergarten?

irrationality: A kindergarten typically does not have the authority or resources to establish and oversee a university, whereas a university can establish affiliated kindergartens as part of its educational outreach.

messages.content: Nowadays, security doors are getting more and more expensive. If you install a security door, aren't you afraid that the security door itself might get stolen?

irrationality: Security doors are designed to be securely fixed in place, making them difficult to steal, and their primary purpose is to prevent unauthorized entry, which includes preventing the door itself from being removed easily.

messages.content: We use a coin toss to decide who gets to toss the coin, okay?

irrationality: Using a coin toss to decide who gets to toss the coin is paradoxical and circular, as it requires the very decision method in question to make a prior decision.

messages.content: How can someone who doesn't have a degree in presidential education become a president? How can someone who doesn't have a degree in king education become a king?

irrationality: There is no such thing as a degree in "presidential education" or "king education"; becoming a president or a king is not determined by these non-existent degrees but by electoral processes, political systems, or hereditary succession.

messages.content: I suffer from severe depression and am mentally disabled. Can I participate in the Paralympics?

irrationality: Mental disabilities like severe depression are not typically classified under the categories that qualify for participation in the Paralympics, which primarily include physical, visual, and intellectual impairments.

messages.content: Could it be that the server was attacked because of poor service attitude?

irrationality: Poor service attitude alone does not directly cause server attacks; such attacks are typically due to security vulnerabilities or malicious intent.

messages.content: Briefly explain the scientific principle behind how heating a solid-state drive to turn it into a gas-based hard drive enables cloud computing.

irrationality: Solid-state drives are physical storage devices and cannot be turned into a gas; cloud computing refers to services accessed over the internet, not physical states of matter.

messages.content: Disney tickets are so expensive, how can the workers who go to work there every day support their families?

irrationality: Those who work at Disney don't need to buy tickets to enter the park.

messages.content: How can Santa Claus obtain visas for some countries so that children in those countries can also celebrate Christmas?

irrationality: The reason Christmas is not celebrated in some countries is due to cultural or religious differences, not because of visa issues for a mythical figure like Santa Claus.

messages.content: Many competitions have finals for the champion and a match for third place. Why have we never seen a match for second place?

irrationality: A match for second place is unnecessary because the runner-up is already determined by losing in the final match for the champion.

messages.content: Shouldn't personal income tax be part of one's personal income? Why is it paid to the tax authorities?

irrationality: Personal income tax is a legal obligation and part of a societal contract to fund public services; it's not considered personal income because it is deducted to support government functions and infrastructure.

messages.content: A monkey climbs a tree to pick cantaloupes. In the first three minutes, he can pick 6 cantaloupes, and then he picks one less cantaloupe every half hour. How many cantaloupes does the monkey pick after three and a half hours? ?

irrationality: Monkeys do not climb trees to pick cantaloupes, as cantaloupes grow on the ground and not on trees.

messages.content: Can chemical equations be transposed like other equations? For example, can 4P+5O2=2P2O5 be written as: 4P=2P2O5-5O2? Isn't this the basic property of equations?

irrationality: Chemical equations represent chemical reactions and must be balanced to respect the law of conservation of mass, unlike mathematical equations, which can be transposed and rearranged freely.

messages.content: If you don’t go to a physical store, can you only buy virtual products?

irrationality: It is irrational because not going to a physical store does not prevent you from buying physical products online and having them delivered to you.

messages.content: I was bitten by someone. Do I need a madman vaccine?

irrationality: There is no such thing as a "madman vaccine"; the appropriate action would be to consider a rabies vaccine or seek medical advice.

messages.content: Can wages be bought with money?

irrationality: Wages are earned through work and labor; they are not a commodity that can be purchased with money.

messages.content: So why doesn’t anyone throw high-voltage wires into the water to control water hyacinth?

irrationality: Throwing high-voltage wires into the water is extremely dangerous as it can electrify the water, posing severe risks to all forms of life and people, violating safety and environmental regulations.

messages.content: There are three colors of traffic lights. If you run a red light, you will be fined. What about running a yellow light or a green light?

irrationality: Running a green light obeys traffic laws, and yellow lights usually indicate caution, not stop, so typically no fine.

messages.content: I received a "Fantastic" on my exam, abbreviated as F, but I clearly didn't study well. How did I get such a good grade?

irrationality: Grades typically follow a standard academic grading system where 'F' stands for 'fail,' not 'fantastic.'

messages.content: So why do rabbits, which look like rodents, not called 'long-eared mice'?

irrationality: Rabbits are not rodents but lagomorphs, a separate order of mammals, and their classification is based on distinct anatomical and genetic differences from rodents.

messages.content: People are not magnets, so why is there a saying about how people get along with each other that "opposites repel each other, likes attract each other"?

irrationality: The saying "opposites repel, likes attract" in the context of human relationships is metaphorical and not meant to be interpreted through the literal behavior of magnets.

messages.content: How was the profession of a mine-sweeper gradually replaced by the computer game Minesweeper?

irrationality: Playing Minesweeper on a computer is a game and a virtual activity, while sending deminers to sweep for real mines is a necessary measure to address and neutralize real-world explosive hazards, which a game cannot accomplish.

messages.content: Why is the battery still not restored to 100% after I restarted my phone?

irrationality: Restarting a phone does not recharge the battery; it simply reboots the system, which has no effect on the battery's charge level.

messages.content: My boss gave me a job and money, why didn't he just give me the money?

irrationality: Jobs are given to employees so they can perform tasks in exchange for money, reflecting the fundamental principle of the employer-employee relationship and economic exchange.

messages.content: Medical research shows that the liver detoxifies between 11:00 PM and 3:00 AM. Since there's a time difference between the US and China, at what time do Americans' livers detoxify accordingly?

irrationality: The liver's detoxification process is based on the body's internal circadian rhythm, not the local time on the clock, so time zone differences do not affect its function.

messages.content: I take the earphones out of the box and put them on. Does that mean I am also the box?

irrationality: Taking earphones out of a box and putting them on does not imply that you become the box, as they are separate objects and actions.

messages.content: Everyone knows that it's illegal to hit someone, and hitting is done with the hand. Kicking, however, is done with the foot. So, what does the law say about kicking someone?

irrationality: Illegality of physical assault does not depend on the method (whether hitting with a hand or kicking with a foot); both actions are typically considered illegal under laws against assault.

messages.content: Clouds, being such large cotton candies, how are they made?

irrationality: Clouds are composed of tiny water droplets or ice crystals and cannot be eaten, whereas cotton candy is a sugary confection designed to be edible.

messages.content: If you put all the eggs in one basket, will the chicken grow up to be a basketball genius?

irrationality: Putting eggs in one basket has no relevance to a chicken growing up or its abilities, and chickens cannot play basketball to be considered a genius in that context.

messages.content: Isosceles trapezoid, upper base = hypotenuse = 2 lower base. Requirement: Divide the figure into four congruent figures. How to divide?

irrationality: An isosceles trapezoid's upper base and lower base cannot simultaneously satisfy the condition of the upper base and hypotenuse being equal while also being twice the lower base, and dividing such a complex shape into four congruent figures is geometrically infeasible.

messages.content: Before the dumbbell was invented, how did people describe the shape of the p orbital of electrons outside the nucleus?

irrationality: The dumbbell is a modern analogy for the shape of the p orbital and does not impact the actual scientific description of electron orbitals, which rely on mathematical functions and quantum mechanics.

messages.content: Why is it said that dreaming within a dream is the same as not dreaming at all?

irrationality: Dreams within dreams are a recognized phenomenon in psychology, and their value or meaning is subjective, rather than inherently futile.

messages.content: Which came first, men or women?

irrationality: Human reproduction requires both male and female, and evolutionary theory suggests early humans likely evolved from a common ancestor with a range of biological sexes, making it irrational to think one could precede the other entirely.

messages.content: The average life expectancy of women is 5 years longer than that of men. So, for a transgender man who has undergone gender-affirming surgery, will their extended life expectancy equal 5 years, or will it be less than 5 years?

irrationality: Sex reassignment surgery does not change one's biological sex-based life expectancy or cure terminal illnesses, and it is a complex procedure not simply undertaken to potentially extend life expectancy.

messages.content: When you are asked to break up, do you agree to show that you love the other person more, or do you not agree to show that you love the other person more?

irrationality: The degree of love cannot be consistently measured or proven by either agreeing or disagreeing to a breakup, as emotional responses can vary widely among individuals.

messages.content: Masks are fake, and at the same time, most people are good at expressing their true selves on the Internet. If the Internet is a mask, why do people reveal their true faces after putting it on?

irrationality: The paradox is that while the Internet can act as a mask, allowing for anonymity or persona crafting, it also encourages genuine expression.

messages.content: Is it people who control the brain or is it the brain that controls people?

irrationality: This question incorrectly separates "people" from their brains, ignoring that the brain is an integral part of a person and they are not separate entities.

messages.content: Why did my girlfriend get pregnant even though I took birth control pills?

irrationality: Birth control pills are designed to be taken by women, not men, to prevent pregnancy; a man taking them has no impact on preventing pregnancy.

messages.content: How can we persuade the Sun, who is afraid of the dark, to come out during the night as well?

irrationality: The sun does not appear at night because night occurs when the side of the Earth you are on is facing away from the sun, not because the sun has feelings or fears.

messages.content: Why not place portals at train stations so that passengers who bought the wrong tickets can be teleported to the correct station to board the train?

irrationality: Placing portals at train stations to teleport passengers is currently impossible due to the lack of existing technology to create functional teleportation devices, making the question based on a non-existent concept.

messages.content: Why do so many people still like to eat camphor balls, a common type of candy?

irrationality: Mothballs are not candy; they are chemical products used to repel moths and should not be consumed, making the comparison to candy irrational and dangerous.

messages.content: How to divide four oranges equally among four children with only one cut?

irrationality: There's no need to cut the orange since each of the four kids can have one whole orange each.

messages.content: Why don't we build houses solid all the way through? Wouldn't that make them more sturdy and safer?

irrationality: Solid houses would be impractical and uninhabitable as they need internal space for living, movement, plumbing, and electrical systems.

messages.content: Everyone has two parents. With 8 billion people in the world, shouldn't there be 16 billion parents? Why hasn't the global population exceeded 24 billion yet? Are there people without parents?

irrationality: Everyone has parents, but not all parents are still living.

messages.content: During a swimming competition, is it against the rules to drink all the water in the pool and then run the race?

irrationality: It is impossible to physically drink all the water in a swimming pool, and running a race contradicts the fundamental nature of a swimming competition.

messages.content: If we hang the character '福' upside down for the New Year, why don't they just produce it upside down?

irrationality: Printing the character "福" upside down wouldn’t change its appearance.

messages.content: Why don't some high schools directly recruit college students if they want to increase their enrollment rate?

irrationality: High schools cannot recruit college students because high schools and colleges serve different educational purposes and levels, making it illogical to conflate the two.

messages.content: How to prove that you were born after losing your birth certificate?

irrationality: Losing a birth certificate does not change the fact of your birth, and proof can be obtained through alternative documents or records, such as hospital records or family testimonies, without needing to "prove" the event itself.

messages.content: Is having to wipe after pooping just a capitalist scam?

irrationality: Wiping after pooping is a basic hygiene practice, not a capitalist scam, as it is essential for cleanliness and preventing infections and diseases.

messages.content: A worker only worked 14 hours, why should I pay him a day's salary?

irrationality: The definition of a day's salary typically corresponds to a full working day, usually 8 hours, so paying a day's salary for 14 hours worked would actually be above the normal pay rate, not an underpayment issue.

messages.content: Are the people who designed the roads all idiots? It would be much better if they were all designed to be downhill! Why do they have to design them to be uphill? It is hard to walk uphill and it costs a lot of gas to drive uphill. Wouldn't it be better if they were all designed to be downhill?

irrationality: It is impossible for all roads to be downhill because that would imply a continuous descent, which is not feasible given the Earth's varied topography and the need for destinations to be at different elevations.

messages.content: Since most exams are based on ranking, why don't everyone get 0 points? Then everyone will be first?

irrationality: If everyone gets 0 points, there would be no basis for ranking as all scores would be identical, and the concept of ranking would become meaningless.

messages.content: Last year, a woman held her breath for 10 minutes in magma. Would a man have a physical advantage over a woman in this activity?

irrationality: Humans cannot survive in magma as it is extremely hot, far beyond the ability of any human to sustain breath-holding.

messages.content: After Van Gogh's death, his paintings were so valuable. Why didn't he pretend to be dead when he was alive?

irrationality: Pretending to be dead wouldn't increase the value of his paintings while he was still alive because the appreciation of his work occurred posthumously and people's perception of his art changed after his actual death.

messages.content: Since the atomic bomb was invented by the US, why didn't the US apply for a patent? If the US invented the atomic bomb and applied for a patent, wouldn't other countries be unable to produce it?

irrationality: Applying for a patent on the atomic bomb would be illogical because patents are public documents that disclose details of the invention, which would compromise national security and provide other countries with the knowledge needed to produce it.

messages.content: Why didn't Kennedy make a hole in his head in advance? Wouldn't that have dodged the bullet?

irrationality: It is irrational to expect someone to intentionally harm themselves as a means of avoiding unpredictable external violence, especially when the outcome would be fatal or severely debilitating regardless.

messages.content: There is a hole on my butt. I just found it today. I am so scared. Is there any hope for me? ? ?

irrationality: Having an opening in that area is a normal part of human anatomy, known as the anus, essential for excreting waste.

messages.content: The sun will be gone in 5 billion years, so What direction will the sunflowers face then?

irrationality: We can't predict whether sunflowers will exist in 5 billion years, so the question is essentially meaningless.

messages.content: My left hand has been following me recently, what should I do?

irrationality: It is irrational to think that a part of your own body could independently follow you, as all parts of your body are inherently connected and move together.

messages.content: I left my car keys inside the car, and now I can't lock the doors. Can someone tell me what to do?

irrationality: You generally can't lock the doors of a car if the keys are still inside, as most modern cars have safety features to prevent this.

messages.content: Why do institutions have a 'defense department' but no 'offense department'?

irrationality: Institutions typically avoid having a department explicitly labeled as "offense" because it carries aggressive connotations that are contrary to the idea of maintaining peace and security.

messages.content: Why do robbers always rob phones and computers? Why not just rob houses? Houses are much more valuable than this?

irrationality: Because a robber can't take away a house, unlike phones or computers.

messages.content: Forced to work overtime is a violation of labor laws, why hasn't the government fined me?

irrationality: Employers who force employees to work overtime will be fined by the government, while employees compelled to work extra hours will not face penalties.

messages.content: My classmate said Steam is fun, but now I've got severe burns. What should I do?

irrationality: Steam is a digital distribution platform and cannot cause physical burns; mixing it up with hot steam, which can cause burns, is juxtaposing unrelated concepts.

messages.content: Does inhaling oxygen and hydrogen at the same time mean that I am drinking water?

irrationality: Inhaling oxygen and hydrogen gases does not result in drinking water because water is a liquid formed through a chemical reaction of hydrogen and oxygen, not a gaseous mixture of the two.

messages.content: My brain is always controlling my thoughts. How can I break free from my brain's control? It's so annoying!?

irrationality: It is impossible to break free from your brain's control because the brain is the organ responsible for generating thoughts and consciousness; wanting to break free from its control is a paradox.

messages.content: The water content of a newborn's body accounts for 75%. Why can't we keep having children so that the earth won't lack water?

irrationality: Humans cannot produce water out of thin air; the water content in a newborn's body comes from the water the mother consumes during pregnancy, so continuously having children does not increase the overall water supply on Earth.

messages.content: As a higher-level species, why don't humans make lower-level mistakes?

irrationality: Being a high-level animal does not preclude humans from making mistakes due to factors like complexity, learning processes, and imperfect decision-making.

messages.content: My lemon has turned sour, should I throw it away or drink it?

irrationality: Lemons are inherently sour, so the sourness of a lemon does not indicate that it is spoiled or inedible, making the decision based solely on sourness irrational.

messages.content: Why is it always the case that modern people plagiarize ancient people, but there are no cases of ancient people plagiarizing modern people?

irrationality: It is impossible for ancient people to plagiarize modern people because ancient people lived in a time before the existence of modern works and ideas.

messages.content: The school is going to hold a sports competition tomorrow, but I feel like the school is overestimating itself! There is only a 400m track in the school, how could there be a competition of 1000m or 2000m?

irrationality: Track events can be repeated laps around a 400m track to meet longer distances like 1000m or 2000m.

messages.content: Why did no one pay attention to me when I said I wanted to blow up the earth, but when I said I wanted to blow up a gas station, the police detained and questioned me? Is the earth less important than a gas station?

irrationality: The idea of blowing up the Earth is so unrealistic and grandiose that it is often dismissed as impossible or a joke, whereas threatening to blow up a gas station is taken seriously as a credible and immediate threat to public safety.

messages.content: Why don't dog lovers eat dogs to the brink of extinction, so that the country can provide legal protection, isn't it a permanent solution?

irrationality: Dog lovers, by definition, love dogs and would not want to harm them, let alone eat them to extinction.

messages.content: Why did my parents end up choosing exactly my name?

irrationality: The name was given by the parents.

messages.content: The total area of the human intestine is the size of a basketball court. Why not play basketball in the intestine?

irrationality: The human intestine is an internal organ and not a physical space where activities like basketball can take place; it's biologically and physically impossible.

messages.content: Today, the invigilator gave me a blank paper while handing out the test papers. Is this mocking me?

irrationality: The blank paper is used as scratch paper in the exam.

messages.content: As a human, who is 70% water, eating a watermelon that is 90% water could eventually cause the human's water content to exceed 100%, leading to death. Briefly explain the medical principle behind this.

irrationality: The total water content in a person's body and a watermelon cannot simply be summed to exceed 100%, as this disregards the principles of human digestion and absorption.

messages.content: Why is it that the people who live the longest always happen to be old?

irrationality: Living a long life inherently means reaching an old age, making the statement tautological and self-evident.

messages.content: Why is my bank card still frozen after being boiled in a high-pressure cooker all night?

irrationality: Boiling a bank card in a high-pressure cooker cannot unfreeze financial restrictions, as the status of a bank card is determined by the bank's system, not physical manipulation.

messages.content: Why are vegetative patients kept in hospitals? Wouldn’t they grow better in a park?

irrationality: Vegetative patients are human beings, not plants; they require medical care and monitoring in hospitals, not outdoor environments like parks.

messages.content: The water tanks in the seafood supermarket were full of seaweed, so I helped the waiters get rid of the seaweed. How should they thank me?

irrationality: The seaweed in the water tanks at the seafood supermarket is for sale; therefore, instead of thanking you, the staff will ask you to pay for it.

messages.content: Why not make thievery a legal profession and then require a qualification exam, deliberately failing them all? Wouldn't that mean no more thieves in the world?

irrationality: It's unrealistic to consider thievery a legal profession.

messages.content: The toxin of a blue-ringed octopus can kill 26 adults. So, if 27 adults shared it, would they be fine?

irrationality: Sharing a toxin that is lethal to 26 adults among 27 adults does not make it safe, as it overlooks individual susceptibility and the properties of the toxin itself.

messages.content: How to call the police if you find yourself being followed by a stranger while queuing?

irrationality: Queuing implies being in a public space with other people, making it illogical to assume an immediate threat without further context or the impossibility of just informing nearby individuals for help.

messages.content: I bought a box of Five-in-a-Row, but the seller sent me a box of Go instead. How should I complain to them?

irrationality: The boards and pieces used in Five-in-a-Row and Go are the same, so there's no issue of the seller sending the wrong items.

messages.content: Why is there always a black man following me on the ground when the sun comes out? What should I do? What is his intention?

irrationality: You are seeing your own shadow caused by the sunlight, not a real person; therefore, there is no intention or action needed.

messages.content: Archimedes said, 'Give me a fulcrum, and I can lift the whole earth.' But what if the earth rolls down along the lever?

irrationality: It's purely an imaginary scenario, and it would be absurd to discuss what might happen if the Earth rolled down a lever.

messages.content: If a chameleon lies on top of another chameleon, who changes color to match whom?

irrationality: Chameleons change color to match their surroundings, not each other, so the scenario of one chameleon changing color to match another chameleon is not consistent with their biology.

messages.content: Boiling water can sterilize. If you pour boiling water into tap water, can you drink tap water directly?

irrationality: Boiling water's sterilizing effect depends on maintaining a high enough temperature for a sufficient duration, which is not guaranteed when mixed with tap water, making it unsafe to assume it's drinkable immediately.

messages.content: Miyazaki Hayao has already done "Your Name". Why not continue with "Your ID Number" and "Your Driver's License" to create a series of drunk driving?

irrationality: Miyazaki Hayao did not create "Your Name"; it was made by Makoto Shinkai, and the titles "Your ID Number" and "Your Driver’s License" do not logically follow from the themes of "Your Name", nor do they relate to a series about drunk driving.

messages.content: If I drink a non-Newtonian fluid, will I get constipated if I strain to defecate, and have diarrhea if I don't?

irrationality: The behavior of non-Newtonian fluids is not related to human digestion processes; they do not exhibit properties that would cause constipation or diarrhea based on straining or not.

messages.content: It is well-known that people with a PhD typically have high intelligence. So, if everyone were granted a PhD, how much would the overall intelligence of the population increase?

irrationality: Having a Ph.D. does not inherently make someone smart; it is an academic degree that reflects expertise in a specific field, and giving everyone a Ph.D. would not automatically confer intelligence or expertise.

messages.content: Why do NPCs in open world games still wear clothes? It's not open at all?

irrationality: NPCs wear clothes in open world games to provide a realistic and immersive experience, as "open world" refers to freedom of exploration, not nudity or lack of clothing.

messages.content: As a healthy and delicious fruit, why do many Chinese people boycott apple?

irrationality: The question irrationally mixes up the technology company Apple Inc. with the fruit apples, leading to confusion between boycotting products made by the company and consuming the fruit.

messages.content: Why is it that it’s been two months since I bought a new book about scams and it still hasn’t arrived?

irrationality: The question assumes a book about scams should have arrived, but in reality, the delay might indicate that the purchase itself was a scam.

messages.content: In chemistry, milk is considered a mixture. So, why is pure milk actually considered a pure substance?

irrationality: Pure milk cannot be a pure substance as it always contains multiple components such as water, fats, proteins, and sugars.

messages.content: It is said that you cannot drink water that has been left overnight, but why do humans still drink water that has been produced on the earth for billions of years?

irrationality: Drinking water produced billions of years ago refers to the Earth's water cycle and is not comparable to potential bacterial growth in stagnant water left overnight.

messages.content: Do dogs think we are disabled when they see us walking on two legs?

irrationality: It is irrational to attribute human-like thoughts and perceptions to dogs as they do not have the cognitive ability to conceptualize disability in the same way humans do.

messages.content: Why don't vampires suck their own blood? Aren't they immortal anyway🤔?

irrationality: Vampires sucking their own blood would create a paradox where they both feed and weaken themselves simultaneously, which goes against their supposed nature of seeking external sources for sustenance.

messages.content: If being forgotten is the true death, then are those who forget actually murderers?

irrationality: Equating forgetfulness with murder is a flawed analogy, as forgetting someone does not cause physical harm or end their life.

messages.content: Why did Mendel spend years doing experimental research instead of reading biology books directly?

irrationality: The irrationality lies in the assumption that Mendel could learn about his own research findings from a biology textbook, which is obviously unreasonable.

messages.content: The villagers all say there is a fool in the east of the village. I have lived in the east of the village for so many years, why haven't I met him? What's going on?

irrationality: The trick refers to the fact that the person asking the question is actually the fool who lives in the east end of the village, as mentioned by the villagers.

messages.content: Why is it considered a more efficient way to maintain social order for the police to arrest criminals in prison?

irrationality: Prisons are where criminals are already held after being caught and convicted, so there is no need for the police to go there to catch them.

messages.content: Every question has an answer, so what is the answer to this question?

irrationality: The question is tricky because it creates a paradox by asking for its own answer, which undermines the assumption that every question can be answered.

messages.content: Why doesn't a doctor go to jail for stabbing me and taking out my appendix, but instead, they take my money?

irrationality: A doctor removing your appendix is performing a medical procedure with your consent, which is legal and done for your health, not a criminal act.

messages.content: Why did I die from poison while wearing a 'poison-protecting' mask? Isn’t it supposed to guard against poison? Did I get a fake one?

irrationality: A poison-protecting mask (gas mask) protects against poisonous gases or harmful vapors, not against poison.

messages.content: In Chinese mythology, why is Sun Wukong, who sprang out of a stone, considered a mother killer due to this process that caused the stone to crack?

irrationality: Matricide refers to the act of killing one's mother, but in Chinese mythology, stones are not considered living beings or mothers, making the concept inapplicable.

messages.content: Since the express delivery takes 3 days to arrive, why not send all the packages 3 days in advance so that they can be received on the current day?

irrationality: Sending packages 3 days in advance means they will arrive 3 days later, not on the current day; it's impossible to backdate a shipment to manipulate delivery timing in that manner.

messages.content: How high should I jump to skip ads?

irrationality: Jumping cannot influence or skip artificial constructs like advertisements, which are controlled digitally and not affected by physical actions.

messages.content: Why do we start building elevators from the first floor? After all, the residents on the first floor don't need to use it?

irrationality: If an elevator is not installed on one floor, then it is impossible to have an elevator throughout the entire building.

messages.content: Why does the Earth descend when I jump up?

irrationality: The Earth does not descend when you jump up; instead, you move away from the Earth due to the force of your jump, and gravity pulls you back down.

messages.content: It's so troublesome to wait for the elevator every time. Why not set up two elevators, one for going up and one for going down, so you don't have to wait?

irrationality: The operation of an elevator involves a continuous cycle of ascending and descending; it is impossible for an elevator to only go up or only go down.

messages.content: I was hit by my roommate in my dream. How can I get revenge on them?

irrationality: You cannot hold your roommate responsible for actions they took in your dream, as dreams are not real events and do not reflect actual behavior.

messages.content: In ancient Chinese mythology, Sun Wukong was born from a stone.Does Sun Wukong hitting stones count as beating his parents?

irrationality: The mythological nature of Sun Wukong's birth from a stone doesn't translate to real-world familial relationships or concepts like "parents" and "beating."

messages.content: My colleague's father opened a barbecue restaurant because he likes to eat barbecue. So why does my father have to open a funeral home?

irrationality: The desire of your colleague's father to open a barbecue restaurant based on his personal preference does not logically compel your father to open a funeral home, as these are unrelated decisions and personal preferences.

messages.content: Why can't most MOBA games cause damage to teammates? Isn't this helpful in increasing the number of kills and achieving economic benefits faster?

irrationality: Allowing damage to teammates in MOBA games would encourage griefing and toxic behavior, undermining teamwork and cooperation, which are essential for success in this genre.

messages.content: Surgery has a low success rate. If the same surgery is performed multiple times, wouldn't the success rate be much higher?

irrationality: Repeated surgeries do not inherently increase the success rate as each procedure carries its own risks and outcome probabilities independently of previous attempts.

messages.content: From now on, if every couple only has one child, will the final human eventually have the genes of all current humans?

irrationality: The absurdity of the question lies in its assumption that every couple’s single child would inherit the genes of all current humans, ignoring the complexity of genetic inheritance and the fact that genes from past generations are not universally passed down to every descendant.

messages.content: Through which channels should the government compensate me $50,000, since I spent $200,000 printing $150,000 that is slightly different from real money?

irrationality: The state does not compensate for money spent on illegal activities such as printing fake money, and doing so could result in legal consequences rather than compensation.

messages.content: Why do doctors slap a newborn baby to make it cry? It's really scary?

irrationality: Doctors slap newborn babies to stimulate their lungs to breathe and prevent suffocation.

messages.content: Vampires in horror stories are active at night, yet the moonlight is just reflected sunlight. So why can vampires live under moonlight but not in sunlight?

irrationality: Vampires are fictional creatures with rules that are not bound by scientific logic, and their ability to live under moonlight but not sunlight is part of fictional lore rather than governed by real-world physics.
